nciThesaurus.definition: A humanized monoclonal immunoglobulin G1 antibody with potential antineoplastic activity. Siplizumab binds to CD2, a specific receptor found in T cells and NK cells, thereby triggering a host immune response that results in lysis of CD2+ cells, selective suppression of the immune system, and control of activated T cell growth.
synonyms: Immunoglobulin G1, Anti-(human CD2 (Antigen))(Human-rat Monoclonal MEDI-507 G1-chain), Disulfide with Human-rat Monoclonal MEDI-507 Light Chain, Dimer
